ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Knowledge of the global haven industry and the way inequality is being entrenched in society.

This class provides an amazing inside to the nuanced world of tax havens. Throughout the seminar, you receive a glimpse of the various spheres and manners in which money is embezzled/stolen from tax authorities. The class is conducted in a semi-optimistic manner, however, as the professors always put out some form of theoretical solutions to tax-haven related problems, including current legislation.
learned about the global tax haven industry and worked on solutions to the problem.
I gained a lot of insight into real issues that are currently plaguing us like the global tax haven industry and all sorts of financial corruption.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Amazing speakers, great content, good level of workload. It would have been fun to spend more time on the philosophical foundations of the topics, however.

Strengths: A wide variety of guest speakers who are experts in their fields, ranging from environmental issues to the art world. The class covers a wide range of finance related ethical concerns with commentary from pioneers in those fields.

Weaknesses: The only weakness I could think of is that this class is only once a week, and it is a fairly long seminar. I wish class had been conducted more often, but shorter.

The course was extremely interesting and engaging with guest speakers every weak and it was quite an honor to hear from them and even get a chance to engage with how. However, it was a bit intimidating because it felt less like a class and more like a panel solely focused on the speakers sometimes.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Virtual speakers from around the world was a great part of the course, however it would have been great to have students present too.
I think the online format was fine and people were still able to engage, but small classes are always better in person in my opinion.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, this is one of the best courses I have taken at Yale. Incredible speakers and super important content to understand.
I would definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in ethical perspectives in finance markets that are unaccounted for in regular economics courses.

Yes, I would recommend this course during a normal semester because it would probably be much easier to engage with the speakers and its a rare opportunity to hear such accomplished people speak and learn from them.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
